Articles.Content:
I just spent half an hour looking at old screenshots I have taken in previous versions of KSP. And it made me remember all those special moments. First orbit, mun landing, docking, you name it. And I realized that I love this game. It's the only game that have made me... feel for it, if you know what I mean. I have feelings for those little kerbals

Anyways, I'd just like to thank Squad for their amazing work. Keep it up guys!

It's a great game but i cannot share earlier memories, all my great moments came in the last three weeks as i got the game through Steam. I have 230 screenshots, that's just crazy and i expect i'l look back over them with the same feelings in the future.

Amen to that. This is a game (i hate calling it a game, its MOAR) that you end up feeling passionate about. And not just about the Kerbals (although how many other games do you care so much to spend hours doing rescue missions) but its about the distance (in terms of understanding) that you go, the things you create, the hours spent dreaming of what else you can do. Truly KSP is an amazing work of art.

Ahhh sweet memories, first orbit, first munar orbit, first attempted (and of many failed) mun landings in the demo, what I think was my first deep space kraken attack (scared the hell outta me)

Sweet memories

Thank you squad for creating such an awesome game
The many times I have jumped out of my skin when my ship spontaneously explodes...."sigh"
I have not played long enough to have had this experience yet. Though I can say I have had this experience with many other games, so I certainly know how you feel.
I remember back in the good days when there was no map screen so I just flew straight up and then to the side and I hoped it would get me into orbit. I never did.

I still have 0.13.2 installed, actually.

(10 characters)

I still have 0.13.2 installed, actually.

It's rather amazing going back and seeing how far the game has come. I've still got a copy of every major release since 0.13 Could never bring myself to kill off my saves.
I also can't bring myself to uninstall my prior versions of the game. I had way too much fun with them to just throw them away.

I have 2577 screenshots in 19.1 alone, not counting my archive from 18.x

Only a few from the 0.13 demo, which I've still got around somewhere.
I have archived every version from the first demo up. So proud of it.
I still have all versions up to 0.13.3 as well as the screenshots alongside. Although, I think the screenshots probably need a fair bit of organisation..
Yup, I remember my first day on the game - after about two hours I got into orbit, stranding the Kerbals there. THEN I discovered the map view.
I still remember my first rocket...it escaped Kerbin infuence on the first launch.

I still have 0.13.2 installed, actually.

Me too Not to mention every other version
